treebank.comment:
This XML file has been created by Giuseppe G. A. Celano, 24 February, 2015, at Leipzig University.
The text is Harpocrationis Lexicon in decem oratores Atticos, ed. Wilhelm Dindorf, Oxonii: E Typographeo Academico, Oxford, 1853.
The text comes from PerseusDL: https://github.com/PerseusDL/canonical/blob/master/CTS_XML_TEI/perseus/greekLit/tlg1389/tlg001/tlg1389.tlg001.perseus-grc1.xml
The text has been automatically checked for Unicode codepoints, so that it only contains the correct letters from the Unicode Chart "Greek Extended" and Unicode Chart "Greek and Coptic" (for example, no mathematical Greek letters).
I have automatically checked punctuation: all colons (U+003A) have been converted into middle dots (U+00B7) and all combining commas above (U+0313) wrongly standing for apostrophes into modifier letter apostrophes (U+02BC).
